content: Spain Looks To Prosecute Bush Officials Court Will Consider Criminal Case Against Alberto Gonzales, Others For Torture (AP) A Spanish court has agreed to consider opening a criminal case against six former Bush administration officials, including former Attorney General Alberto Gonzales, over allegations they gave legal cover for torture at Guantanamo Bay, a lawyer in the case said Saturday. Human rights lawyers brought the case before leading anti-terror judge Baltasar Garzon, who agreed to send it on to prosecutors to decide whether it had merit, Gonzalo Boye, one of the lawyers who brought the charges, told The Associated Press. The ex-Bush officials are Gonzales; former undersecretary of defense for policy Douglas Feith; former Vice President Dick Cheney's chief of staff David Addington; Justice Department officials John Yoo and Jay S. Bybee; and Pentagon lawyer William Haynes. Read complete article here > >http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/03/28/world/main4900114.shtml?tag=topStory;topStoryHeadline

Human rights lawyers brought the case before leading anti-terror judge Baltasar Garzon, who agreed to send it on to prosecutors to decide whether it had merit, Gonzalo Boye, one of the lawyers who brought the charges, told The Associated Press. The ex-Bush officials are Gonzales; former undersecretary of defense for policy Douglas Feith; former Vice President Dick Cheney's chief of staff David Addington; Justice Department officials John Yoo and Jay S. content: Dave, while it isn't THIS administration doing the investigation. It is Spain's gov't currently doing it. It will be interesting to see what happens, though. It would be one heck of a situation to have a prior POTUS or VP indicted by the courts for war crimes. But I agree, it wouldn't happen here. Too much chance of it to come back and bite them in the butt. It would be like Ford pardoning Nixon, "for the good of the nation to move on" I believe is the paraphrase of it.

content: Aint gonna Happen 1- Universal Jurisdiction isnt recognized except in these countries: Belgium Canada France Germany Israel Spain United Kingdom 2- the UN doesnt even recognize it. as well, Immunity applies: XXXhttp://www.unis.unvienna.org/unis/pressrels/2002/afr379.htmlXXX This Judge has a Habit of going after Foreigners and his "Batting Record" is .000 He also was going after Francisco Franco and alledged Atrocites from the spanish Civil War Never mind Franco's Been Dead, or that there was an AMNESTY that absolved anyone from such actions (on both sides) in 1977. He's a Socialist with an Agenda, so remember Children be careful what your asking for. In 4 years he could be asking for Barack, Biden, Holder. Hell If I can convince a Judge in Israel that Obama is a war criminal can He be extradited? Think about it, If all it took were a Judges say-so. Italy could get Belgiums leader indicted, We could get Kim Jong Il Indicted, Pakistan could get Obama indicted, Georgia could get Putin indicted, ad infinitum.... This Judges cases get overturned regularly.

title: Spain Looks To Prosecute Bush Officials

content: Spain Looks To Prosecute Bush Officials Court Will Consider Criminal Case Against Alberto Gonzales, Others For Torture (AP) A Spanish court has agreed to consider opening a criminal case against six former Bush administration officials, including former Attorney General Alberto Gonzales, over allegations they gave legal cover for torture at Guantanamo Bay, a lawyer in the case said Saturday. Human rights lawyers brought the case before leading anti-terror judge Baltasar Garzon, who agreed to send it on to prosecutors to decide whether it had merit, Gonzalo Boye, one of the lawyers who brought the charges, told The Associated Press. The ex-Bush officials are Gonzales; former undersecretary of defense for policy Douglas Feith; former Vice President Dick Cheney's chief of staff David Addington; Justice Department officials John Yoo and Jay S. Bybee; and Pentagon lawyer William Haynes. Read complete article here > >http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/03/28/world/main4900114.shtml?tag=topStory;topStoryHeadline

Human rights lawyers brought the case before leading anti-terror judge Baltasar Garzon, who agreed to send it on to prosecutors to decide whether it had merit, Gonzalo Boye, one of the lawyers who brought the charges, told The Associated Press. The ex-Bush officials are Gonzales; former undersecretary of defense for policy Douglas Feith; former Vice President Dick Cheney's chief of staff David Addington; Justice Department officials John Yoo and Jay S. content: Dave, while it isn't THIS administration doing the investigation. It is Spain's gov't currently doing it. It will be interesting to see what happens, though. It would be one heck of a situation to have a prior POTUS or VP indicted by the courts for war crimes. But I agree, it wouldn't happen here. Too much chance of it to come back and bite them in the butt. It would be like Ford pardoning Nixon, "for the good of the nation to move on" I believe is the paraphrase of it.

content: Aint gonna Happen 1- Universal Jurisdiction isnt recognized except in these countries: Belgium Canada France Germany Israel Spain United Kingdom 2- the UN doesnt even recognize it. as well, Immunity applies: XXXhttp://www.unis.unvienna.org/unis/pressrels/2002/afr379.htmlXXX This Judge has a Habit of going after Foreigners and his "Batting Record" is .000 He also was going after Francisco Franco and alledged Atrocites from the spanish Civil War Never mind Franco's Been Dead, or that there was an AMNESTY that absolved anyone from such actions (on both sides) in 1977. He's a Socialist with an Agenda, so remember Children be careful what your asking for. In 4 years he could be asking for Barack, Biden, Holder. Hell If I can convince a Judge in Israel that Obama is a war criminal can He be extradited? Think about it, If all it took were a Judges say-so. Italy could get Belgiums leader indicted, We could get Kim Jong Il Indicted, Pakistan could get Obama indicted, Georgia could get Putin indicted, ad infinitum.... This Judges cases get overturned regularly.
